data.enText: the battle lines are drawn

data.chText: 战线已经划清（指争战之际各拥一方形成对垒之势）
data.enText: used to say that people or groups have shown which side they intend to support in an argument or contest that is going to begin
do battle (with sb) (over sth)

data.chText: （同某人就某事）进行斗争（或辩论）
data.enText: to fight or argue with sb
half the battle

data.chText: （完成某事的）关键；最艰难的阶段
data.enText: the most important or difficult part of achieving sth
fight a losing battle

data.chText: 打一场无望取胜的仗；虽必败无疑犹作奋斗
data.enText: to try to do sth that you will probably never succeed in doing
join battle (with sb)

data.chText: 开始（与某人）交战
data.enText: to begin fighting sb

data.chText: 当地居民就缺少停车设施一事与政务委员会展开了斗争。
data.enText: Local residents have joined battle with the council over the lack of parking facilities.

tr: an energetic attempt to achieve something
example: getting through the crowd was a real struggle
he fought a battle for recognition

tr: a hostile meeting of opposing military forces in the course of a war
example: Grant won a decisive victory in the battle of Chickamauga
he lost his romantic ideas about war when he got into a real engagement

tr: an open clash between two opposing groups (or individuals)
example: the harder the conflict the more glorious the triumph"--Thomas Pain
police tried to control the battle between the pro- and anti-abortion mobs

tr: battle or contend against in or as if in a battle
example: The Kurds are combating Iraqi troops in Northern Iraq
We must combat the prejudices against other races

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 不 + bat 打，击 + e → 不再打击 → 减轻
bat 打，击 + on 物 → 棍，警棍
batt 打，击 + al 表名词 + ion 表名词 → 打仗的〔队伍〕→ 军营
bat 打，击 + ter → 连续猛打
batt〔= bat〕打，击 + le 使… → 战斗
com 加强 + bat 打，击 → 不是一般的打 → 格斗
de 加强 + bat 打，击 + e → 加强打击 → 辩论
em 使… + battl〔e〕打，击 + ed 表形容词 → 使战斗的 → 严阵以待的
re 回 + bat 打，击 + e → 打回去的〔东西〕→ 打折扣

data.chText: 战役；战斗；搏斗
data.enText: a fight between armies, ships or planes, especially during a war; a violent fight between groups of people

data.chText: 滑铁卢战役
data.enText: the battle of Waterloo

data.chText: 阵亡
data.enText: to be killed in battle

data.chText: 枪战
data.enText: a gun battle

data.chText: 较量；争论；斗争
data.enText: a competition, an argument or a struggle between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 要求赔偿的法律斗争
data.enText: a legal battle for compensation

data.chText: 同一家保险公司的争执
data.enText: a battle with an insurance company

data.chText: 智斗
data.enText: a battle of wits (= when each side uses their ability to think quickly to try to win)

data.chText: 意志的较量
data.enText: a battle of wills (= when each side is very determined to win)

data.chText: 奋斗；斗争
data.enText: a determined effort that sb makes to solve a difficult problem or succeed in a difficult situation

data.chText: 她同癌症的长期斗争
data.enText: her long battle against cancer

data.chText: 同偏见作艰苦斗争
data.enText: to fight an uphill battle against prejudice

data.chText: 一场生死斗
data.enText: a battle for survival
the battle lines are drawn

data.chText: 战线已经划清（指争战之际各拥一方形成对垒之势）
data.enText: used to say that people or groups have shown which side they intend to support in an argument or contest that is going to begin
do battle (with sb) (over sth)

data.chText: （同某人就某事）进行斗争（或辩论）
data.enText: to fight or argue with sb
half the battle

data.chText: （完成某事的）关键；最艰难的阶段
data.enText: the most important or difficult part of achieving sth
fight a losing battle

data.chText: 打一场无望取胜的仗；虽必败无疑犹作奋斗
data.enText: to try to do sth that you will probably never succeed in doing

data.chText: 搏斗；奋斗；斗争
data.enText: to try very hard to achieve sth difficult or to deal with sth unpleasant or dangerous

data.chText: 她还在同膝部的伤痛作斗争。
data.enText: She's still battling with a knee injury.

data.chText: 两队拼得很厉害。
data.enText: Both teams battled hard.

data.chText: 两位领导人正在争夺政府控制权。
data.enText: The two leaders are battling for control of the government.

data.chText: 我得用力挣扎才能勉强浮住。
data.enText: I had to battle hard just to stay afloat.

data.chText: 双方将于下周决赛中决一胜负。
data.enText: The two sides will battle it out in the final next week.

data.chText: 他同癌症斗争了四年。
data.enText: He battled cancer for four years.

data.text: campaign ♦ battle ♦ struggle ♦ drive ♦ war ♦ fight

data.chText: 以上各词均指为达到某目的或为阻止某事而作出的努力。
data.enText: These are all words for an effort made to achieve or prevent sth.
campaign

data.chText: 指为社会、商业或政治目的而进行的一系列有计划的活动或运动：
data.enText: a series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim

data.chText: 要求议会改革的运动
data.enText: the campaign for parliamentary reform

data.chText: 广告宣传活动
data.enText: an advertising campaign
battle

data.chText: 指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 她终于赢得了这场要求赔偿的法律斗争。
data.enText: She finally won the legal battle for compensation.

data.chText: 人与大自然永无休止的斗争
data.enText: the endless battle between man and nature
struggle

data.chText: 指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 为独立的斗争
data.enText: the struggle for independence

data.chText: 正邪之争
data.enText: the struggle between good and evil

data.chText: 用battle还是struggle？
在许多情况下，上述两词可替换使用，但struggle总是用于似乎绝对必要的斗争，如关乎生死、自由等；battle还可用于非绝对必要的斗争，如仅仅是想望或者为了获得胜利的满足感：
data.enText: In many cases you can use either word, but a struggle is always about things that seem absolutely necessary, such as life and death or freedom. A battle can also be about things that are not absolutely necessary, just desirable, or about the pleasure of winning.

data.chText: 正邪之争
data.enText: the battle/struggle between good and evil
a legal struggle for compensation
a struggle of wills/wits
battle or struggle?
drive

data.chText: 指团体为达到目的而作出的有组织的努力：
data.enText: an organized effort by a group of people to achieve sth

data.chText: 为提高效率而进行的运动
data.enText: the drive for greater efficiency

data.chText: 为减少能源消耗而发起的运动
data.enText: a drive to reduce energy consumption

data.chText: 用campaign还是drive？
campaign通常为发动别人参加的运动；drive可指让自己作出努力：
data.enText: A campaign is usually aimed at getting other people to do sth; a drive may be an attempt by people to get themselves to do sth.

data.chText: 从今天起，我们要展开厉行节约运动。
data.enText: From today, we're going on an economy drive (= we must spend less) .

data.chText: campaign可指比drive更大规模、更正式和更有组织的活动或运动。
data.enText: A campaign may be larger, more formal and more organized than a drive .
campaign or drive?
war

data.chText: 指为消灭或阻止有害事物而进行的长期斗争：
data.enText: [sing.] an effort over a long period of time to get rid of or stop sth bad

data.chText: 扑灭罪行的斗争
data.enText: the war against crime
fight

data.chText: 指为制止或防止坏事物或为达到好目的而进行的斗争，或指竞赛，尤指体育竞赛：
data.enText: [sing.] the work of trying to stop or prevent sth bad or achieve sth good; an act of competing, especially in a sport

data.chText: 工人赢得了阻止强制裁员的斗争。
data.enText: Workers won their fight to stop compulsory redundancies.

data.chText: 用war还是fight？
war用于制止人人摒弃的事物（如毒品和犯罪）而进行的斗争；fight可用于为自己伸张正义而进行的斗争。
data.enText: A war is about stopping things, like drugs and crime, that everyone agrees are bad. A fight can be about achieving justice for yourself.
war or fight?
a campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight for/against sth
a(n) strong/intensive/determined/concerted campaign/drive
a one-man/one-woman/personal campaign/battle/struggle/war/fight
a bitter/fierce campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight
to launch/mount/start/lead/be engaged in/carry on/keep up a campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight
to conduct/organize/run/manage a campaign/drive/war/fight
to win/lose a battle/struggle/war/fight

simple_means.memory_skill: batt〔= bat〕打，击 + le 使… → 战斗

ex.chText: 这两个村子团结起来与共同的敌人战斗。
ex.enText: The two villages banded together to fight their common enemy.

ex.chText: 有两个男人在街上打架。
ex.enText: Two man are fighting with each other in the street.

ex.chText: 由于缺少食物，那一地区的大部分村民不得不与饥饿作斗争。
ex.enText: Most of the villagers in that area have to fight against hunger due to lack of food.

ex.chText: 他们正在争取加薪。
ex.enText: They are fighting for higher wages.

synonyms.bx: 指作战、打架斗殴，或指努力想做某事或得到某事物。

ex.chText: 那些勇敢的消防员正在与烈火搏斗。
ex.enText: Those brave firefighters are battling the flames.

ex.chText: 那个人与癌症抗争。
ex.enText: The man had battled against cancer.

ex.chText: 工人们正在为提高福利待遇而斗争。
ex.enText: Workers are battling for better welfare.

ex.chText: 两军彻夜战斗。
ex.enText: The two armies battled all night.

synonyms.bx: 主要指为达到某一目的而与困难、危险等作斗争；也指参战或作战。

ex.chText: 各快递公司在努力应付高成本。
ex.enText: Express companies are struggling with high costs.

ex.chText: 警察赶到时他正与小偷厮打。
ex.enText: He was struggling with the thief when the police came.

ex.chText: 我们拼命争抢那把枪。
ex.enText: We struggled for possession of the gun.

synonyms.bx: 指为实现某事而作出极大的努力，也指为脱身而与他人搏斗或为得到某物而与他人争抢。

ex.chText: 我们在打一场正义战争。
ex.enText: We are fighting a just war.

ex.chText: 和平的曙光已经出现，但战争的危险依然存在。
ex.enText: The dawn of peace has appeared, but the danger of war still remains.

ex.chText: 人类必须结束战争，否则战争就会毁灭人类。
ex.enText: Mankind must put an end to war, or war will put an end to mankind.

synonyms.bx: 通常指敌对国家之间或国内敌对势力之间进行的大规模武力战争，其中可包括多个战役（battle）。

ex.chText: 他的儿子在越战中阵亡。
ex.enText: His son was killed in action in Vietnam.

ex.chText: 他们跟更为强大的军队作战。
ex.enText: They went into action against superior forces.

ex.chText: 军事战斗可以避免吗？
ex.enText: Can military action be avoided?

synonyms.bx: 指战争中的军事行动，为不可数名词。

ex.chText: 那是整个战争中最为关键的一次战役。
ex.enText: It was the most crucial battle in the whole war.

ex.chText: 经过一场决战后，我们取得了战争的胜利。
ex.enText: We won the war after a decisive battle.

synonyms.bx: 通常指敌对双方的军队之间的交战，尤指大型战争中的某一次战役。

ex.chText: 吉尔下士阵亡了。
ex.enText: Corporal Jill was killed in combat/action.

ex.chText: 他们在战斗中被彻底击败。
ex.enText: They were decisively defeated in combat/action.

ex.chText: 士兵们接受了徒手格斗训练。
ex.enText: The soldiers were trained in unarmed combat.

synonyms.bx: 指战争中的军事行动，尤指小规模的战斗，作此义解时常可与action 换用；也可指人或群体间的打斗。

ex.chText: 经过一场激战，敌人向我军投降了。
ex.enText: After a fierce fight, the enemy yielded to our army.

ex.chText: 士兵们在战斗中用尽了所有的弹药。
ex.enText: The soldiers expended all their ammunition in the fight.

ex.chText: 汤姆老是在学校打架。
ex.enText: Tom's always getting into fights at school.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，尤指敌对军队间为争夺某一地方或位置而进行的战斗，也可指人或帮派之间的争斗。

value.def: A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war.

example.ex: ...the victory of King William III at the Battle of the Boyne.
example.tran: 国王威廉三世在博因河战役中的胜利

example.ex: ...after a gun battle between police and drug traffickers.
example.tran: 在警察和毒贩子一番枪战之后

example.ex: ...men who die in battle.
example.tran: 在战斗中阵亡的人们

value.def: A battle is a conflict in which different people or groups compete in order to achieve success or control.

example.ex: ...a renewed political battle over Britain's  attitude to Europe.
example.tran: 围绕英国对欧洲的态度问题展开的新一轮政治斗争

example.ex: ...the eternal battle between good and evil in the world.
example.tran: 世界上正义与邪恶的永恒斗争

example.ex: ...a macho battle for supremacy...
example.tran: 男性为争取支配地位而进行的斗争

example.ex: He was appalled to discover members of the board fighting damaging personal battles.
example.tran: 他惊恐地发现董事会成员正在进行你死我活的私人争斗。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N prep

value.tran: （为争取成功或控制权的）斗争，冲突

value.def: You can use battle to refer to someone's efforts to achieve something in spite of very difficult circumstances.

example.ex: ...the battle against crime...
example.tran: 打击犯罪的斗争

example.ex: She has fought a constant battle with her weight...
example.tran: 她一直在竭力控制体重。

example.ex: Greg lost his brave battle against cancer two years ago.
example.tran: 格雷格在与癌症进行了勇敢的斗争之后于两年前去世。

value.def: To battle with an opposing group means to take part in a fight or contest against them. In American English, you can also say that one group or person is battling another.

example.ex: Thousands of people battled with police and several were reportedly wounded...
example.tran: 数千人与警方发生冲突，据报道有数人在冲突中受伤。

example.ex: The sides must battle again for a quarter-final place on December 16...
example.tran: 双方将在12月16日再次交锋以争夺进入四分之一决赛的席位。

example.ex: They're also battling the government to win compensation.
example.tran: 他们也在跟政府交涉以争取补偿。

value.def: To battle means to try hard to do something in spite of very difficult circumstances. In British English, you battle against something or with something. In American English, you battle something.

example.ex: Doctors battled throughout the night to save her life.
example.tran: 医生们彻夜奋战来挽救她的生命。

example.ex: ...a lone yachtsman returning from his months of battling with the elements...
example.tran: 只身驾驶游艇与恶劣天气搏斗数月后成功归航的人

example.ex: In Wyoming, firefighters are still battling the two blazes.
example.tran: 在怀俄明州，消防员还在为扑灭这两场大火而奋战。

value.tran: 奋战；（与…）搏斗（在英国英语中用battle against something或with something，在美国英语中用battle something）

example.ex: If anyone can do it, he can. He's a battler and has a strong character.
example.tran: 只要有人能做到这一点，他就能做到。他是一位斗士，个性坚毅。

value.def: If one person or group does battle with another, they take part in a battle or contest against them. You can also say that two people or groups do battle .

example.ex: ...the notorious Montonero guerrilla group who did battle with the army during the dirty war...
example.tran: 曾在那场肮脏的战争中与这支部队交战的臭名昭著的蒙特内罗游击队

example.ex: This March, a British and an American company will do battle in the High Court over the right to press compact discs.
example.tran: 今年3月，一家英国公司和一家美国公司将会在最高法院就光盘压制权展开争夺。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, PHR <l>with/against</l> n, pl-n PHR

value.def: If you say that something is half the battle, you mean that it is the most important step towards achieving something.

example.ex: Choosing the right type of paint for the job is half the battle.
example.tran: 选对了涂料，这项工作就成功了一半。

value.tran: 成功的一半；成功的重要条件

value.def: If you say that the battle lines are drawn between opposing groups or people, you mean that they are ready to start fighting or arguing, and that it has become clear what the main points of conflict or disagreement will be.

example.ex: The battle lines were drawn after the government refused to budge from its final offer.
example.tran: 政府拒绝改变其最后条件之后，双方对立态势趋向明朗。

value.tran: 战线已划定；对垒之势已成

value.def: If you are fighting a losing battle, you are trying to achieve something but are not going to be successful.

example.ex: The crew fought a losing battle to try to restart the engines.
example.tran: 全体船员努力尝试重新启动发动机，但结果徒劳无功。

example.ex: ...on a day when the sun is fighting a losing battle against the lowering clouds.
example.tran: 那天，太阳慢慢被低垂的云层遮蔽起来。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, oft PHR <l>with/against</l> n, PHR to-inf

value.def: If one group or person battles it out with another, they take part in a fight or contest against each other until one of them wins or a definite result is reached. You can also say that two groups or two people battle it out .

example.ex: In the Cup Final, Leeds battled it out with the old enemy, Manchester United...
example.tran: 在足总杯决赛中，利兹联队和宿敌曼彻斯特联队一决胜负。

example.ex: Barbados could have three new political parties battling it out in the next General Election.
example.tran: 在下一届大选中，巴巴多斯可能有三个新的政党参加角逐。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, PHR <l>with</l> n, pl-n PHR

value.def: If you say that someone has lost the battle ,but won the war, you mean that although they have been defeated in a small conflict they have won a larger, more important one of which it was a part. If you say that someone has won the battle but lost the war, you mean that they have won the small conflict but lost the larger one.

example.ex: The strikers may have won the battle, but they lost the war.
example.tran: 罢工者们虽胜犹败。

value.tran: 虽败犹胜/ 虽胜犹败

value.def: A battle of wills is a situation that involves people who try to defeat each other by refusing to change their own aims or demands and hoping that their opponents will weaken first.

example.ex: The President offered compromises to parliament to defuse the battle of wills over who should wield power.
example.tran: 总统对国会作出让步，以求结束这场旷日持久的权力争斗。

value.def: If you refer to a situation as a battle of wits, you mean that it involves people with opposing aims who compete with each other using their intelligence, rather than force.

example.ex: With chess you're involved in a battle of wits from start to finish.
example.tran: 下国际象棋从头到尾都是在比拼智慧。

trans: 战役
成功的一半；成功的重要条件
与（敌人）作战；与（某事物或某人）作斗争
与（敌人）作战；与（某事）作斗争，与（困难等）搏斗
为赢得（某物）而战斗，拼搏
一决胜负；一决高低
战地；战场；战地风云；阵地
前线；战线；古战阵；战线交锋
战斗效能：战斗力
必败的斗争
(战斗中的)呐喊助威，喊杀声；(尤指政治的)战斗口号，口号
战斗群，战斗大队
生存的斗争
战胜
挑战
大混战；多人混战；混战；皇家之战；激烈争辩
不列颠之战；伦敦上空的鹰
群殴；聚众打斗；(军事上的)对阵战
阵亡；战死沙场
认输；打败仗；认输,战败
